Congress must be notified and involved, much in the same way the Administration engaged our allies ahead of the airstrike. As we move forward, our focus should be on keeping our troops safe and protecting American interests. That requires us working together.

The Administration needs Congressional authorization before action is taken that would result in the United States going to war with Iran. The current Congressional Authorizations of Use of Military Force (AUMFs) have been in effect since 2001 & 2002, & they need to be repealed.
The gravity of this should give everybody pause, as this airstrike is tantamount to an act of war against Iran.

The President has the power to use his executive authority for limited strikes; however, only Congress has the sole power to declare war. Congress should come back in session immediately to be briefed on the situation.
